intro: Impatiens peperomioides var. elata, commonly known as the tall impatiens, is a striking tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white, often with a distinctive yellow throat. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its growth habit includes a tall, upright stem that can reach up to 2 meters in height, making it a popular choice for vertical gardening and container planting.
